intro: Omphalogramma elwesianum, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and woodland habitats. The flowers emit a strong fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
